isis.stitle: DOUBLE DIAPHRAGM MGM SPRING BRAKE - REMOVE - CAGING SPRING

svcprocinfo.para: In the event there is loss of air and the vehicle must be towed or whenever the service and spring brake assembly is serviced or removed from the vehicle, the spring brake must be "caged."

step1.para: Before releasing brakes, chock wheels of the vehicle to prevent a runaway.
Remove the plastic end cap from the spring brake chamber ( Figure 5).

Use a 3/4-inch wrench (15/16-inch wrench for TR3036 and TR3636 models). Loosen the release nut ( Figure 9) and remove the nut, flat washer, and release bolt from their storage pocket on side of chamber ( Figure 10).

figure.caption: Figure 10. Release Bolt and Storage Pocket

important.para: If these parts are not stored on the chamber, they must be obtained from vehicle tool box or service department, as the spring brake cannot be CAGED without them.

step1.para: Insert the release bolt into the centerhole of the spring brake chamber ( Figure 11) and, being sure that the formed end of the bolt has entered the hole in the piston inside the chamber, continue to insert the bolt until it bottoms out.

important.para: If you are not absolutely sure of correct bolt-to-piston engagement, repeat this step until you are sure.

step1.para: Turn the release bolt 1/4 turn clockwise and pull the bolt outward to lock the formed end into the piston.

important.para: If the bolt does not lock into the position in less than 1/2-inch outward movement, repeat steps 4 and 5 until you are sure it does lock.

step1.para: Holding the bolt locked into the piston, install the flat washer and the release nut on the end of the release bolt, and turn the nut down against the flat washer until finger tight ( Figure 12).

figure.caption: Figure 12. Install Flat Washer and Nut On Release Bolt (Finger Tight)

step1.para: Use a 3/4-inch wrench (15/16-inch wrench for models TR3036 and TR3636) (DO NOT USE AN IMPACT-TYPE WRENCH). Turn the release nut clockwise until the bolt extends above the nut ( Figure 13) by the amount listed in Table 1.

figure.caption: Figure 13. Turn Release Nut Clockwise Until Measurement Is Obtained

caution.para: Do not exceed the lengths listed in Table 1 and do not exceed 50 ft-lbs. (68 N•m) torque on release nut at any time or damage may occur which could prevent any further correct caging of the spring brake chamber. If 50 ft-lbs. (68 N•m) torque or more is required to obtain the measurement in Table 1, replace the spring brake assembly.

note.para: For easier manual-releasing, apply 90 to 125 psi air pressure to inlet port marked "SPRING BRAKE" before step 4 above, but be sure to exhaust all air pressure after step 7 above.
To reactivate the piggyback/spring brake from its manually released position, reverse the order of steps 1 through 7 above.
When re-installing the release bolt, flat washer and release nut into the storage pocket, torque the nut against the flat washer to 10 ft-lbs. (14 N•m) ( Figure 9).

step1.para: Chock wheels of the vehicle to prevent a runaway.
Remove the plastic end cap from the spring brake chamber ( Figure 5).

Use a 3/4-inch wrench (15/16-inch wrench for TR3036 and TR3636 models). Loosen the release nut ( Figure 9) and remove the nut, flat washer, and release bolt from their storage pocket on the side of the chamber ( Figure 10).

Insert the release bolt into the center hole of the head ( Figure 11) and, being sure that the formed end of the bolt has entered in the piston inside the chamber, continue to insert bolt until it bottoms out.
Turn the bolt 1/4 turn clockwise and pull the bolt outward to lock the formed end into the piston.

important.para: If the bolt does not lock into the position in less than 1/2-inch outward movement, repeat steps 4 and 5 until you are sure it does lock.

step1.para: Apply vehicle parking brake or a minimum of 90 psi air pressure to the inlet port marked "SPRING BRAKE."
Turn the nut down against the flat washer until it is FINGER TIGHT. The bolt should extend above the nut by the amount listed in TABLE 1.

caution.para: If the length of the bolt extending above the nut is less than is listed in TABLE 1, the spring brake chamber is not functioning properly and must be replaced.

step1.para: Completely exhaust air from the spring brake.
